intro: Cyanea acuminata var. calycina, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
